article_title: Independent Reporting Structure a Key to Tenet’s Compliance Effort
article_text: As the financial market volatility that sparked economic concerns earlier in 2016 has abated, the global economy has improved and the outlook for U.S. companies and the U.S. economy has steadied despite weak first-quarter growth. Still, there are reasons many CFOs may retain the trepidation expressed in Deloitte’s first-quarter CFO Signals™ survey. Dr. Ira Kalish, chief global economist, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, discusses whether the factors that caused CFOs’ downward company expectations could reoccur and looks at other potential risks that could impact the global economy.

twitter.description: Vanessa Benavides, chief compliance officer for Tenet Healthcare Corp., talks to Risk & Compliance Journal about how her department is structured, the impact of the Affordable Care Act on compliance and how the company conducts educational outreach with its thousands of employees across the country.
twitter.title: Independent Reporting Structure a Key to Tenet’s Compliance Effort

Still, there are reasons many CFOs may retain the trepidation expressed in Deloitte’s first-quarter CFO Signals™ survey.
Dr. Ira Kalish, chief global economist, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, discusses whether the factors that caused CFOs’ downward company expectations could reoccur and looks at other potential risks that could impact the global economy.
As the financial market volatility that sparked economic concerns earlier in 2016 has abated, the global economy has improved and the outlook for U.S. companies and the U.S. economy has steadied despite weak first-quarter growth.
